00001 /**
00002  * @file queue.c
00003  *
00004  * @date 2009-04-24
00005  * @author: Jean-Lou Dupont
00006  *
00007  *
00008  * The _queue_ module isn't aware of its elements
00009  * and thus it is the responsibility of the clients
00010  * to properly dispose of the _nodes_ once retrieved.
00011  *
00012  * The term ``node`` is used generically to refer
00013  * to a node element inside a queue.
00014  *
00015  */
00016 
00017 #include <pthread.h>
00018 #include <errno.h>
00019 
00020 #include "logger.h"
00021 #include "litm.h"
00022 #include "queue.h"
00023 
00024 
00025 /**
00026  * Creates a queue
00027  */
00028 queue *queue_create(void) {
00029 
00030         // if this malloc fails,
00031         //  there are much bigger problems that loom
00032         pthread_mutex_t *mutex = malloc( sizeof(pthread_mutex_t) );
00033         queue *q = malloc( sizeof(queue) );
00034 
00035         if ((NULL != q) && (NULL != mutex)){
00036 
00037                 q->head  = NULL;
00038                 q->tail  = NULL;
00039 
00040                 pthread_mutex_init( mutex, NULL );
00041                 q->mutex = mutex;
00042 
00043         } else {
00044 
00045                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_create: MALLOC ERROR");
00046 
00047                 if (NULL!=q)
00048                         free(q);
00049 
00050                 if (NULL!=mutex)
00051                         free(mutex);
00052         }
00053 
00054         return q;
00055 }// init
00056 
00057 /**
00058  * Destroys a queue
00059  *
00060  * This function is **not** aware of the
00061  *  message(s) potentially inside the queue,
00062  *  thus, the queue must be drained **before**
00063  *  using this function.
00064  *
00065  * The queue can be drained by:
00066  * - stopping the thread that ``puts``
00067  * - ``getting`` until NULL is returned
00068  *
00069  */
00070 void queue_destroy(queue *q) {
00071 
00072         if (NULL==q) {
00073 
00074                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_destroy: NULL queue ptr");
00075                 return;
00076         }
00077 
00078         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00079                 free(q);
00080                 q=NULL;
00081         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00082 }
00083 
00084 /**
00085  * Queues a node (blocking)
00086  *
00087  * @return 1 => success
00088  * @return 0 => error
00089  *
00090   */
00091 int queue_put(queue *q, void *node) {
00092 
00093         if ((NULL==q) || (NULL==node)) {
00094                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_destroy: NULL queue/node ptr");
00095                 return 0;
00096         }
00097 
00098         int code = 1;
00099         queue_node *tmp=NULL;
00100 
00101         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00102 
00103                 // if this malloc fails,
00104                 //  there are much bigger problems that loom
00105                 tmp = (queue_node *) malloc(sizeof(queue_node));
00106                 if (NULL!=tmp) {
00107 
00108                         tmp->node = node;
00109                         tmp->next = NULL;
00110 
00111                         // there is a tail... put at the end
00112                         if (NULL!=q->tail)
00113                                 (q->tail)->next=tmp;
00114 
00115                         // point tail to the new element
00116                         q->tail = tmp;
00117 
00118                         // adjust head
00119                         if (NULL==q->head)
00120                                 q->head=tmp;
00121 
00122                 } else {
00123                         code = 0;
00124                 }
00125         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00126 
00127         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put: END");
00128 
00129         return code;
00130 }//[/queue_put]

00133 /**
00134  * Queues a node (non-blocking)
00135  *
00136  * @return 1  => success
00137  * @return 0  => error
00138  * @return -1 => busy
00139  *
00140  */
00141 int queue_put_nb(queue *q, void *node) {
00142 
00143         if ((NULL==q) || (NULL==node)) {
00144                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_put_nb: NULL queue/node ptr");
00145                 return 0;
00146         }
00147 
00148         if (EBUSY == pthread_mutex_trylock( q->mutex ))
00149                 return -1;
00150 
00151                 int returnCode = 1; //optimistic
00152                 queue_node *tmp=NULL;
00153 
00154                 // if this malloc fails,
00155                 //  there are much bigger problems that loom
00156                 tmp = (queue_node *) malloc(sizeof(queue_node));
00157                 if (NULL!=tmp) {
00158 
00159                         tmp->node = node;
00160                         tmp->next = NULL;
00161 
00162                                 //insert pointer to element first
00163                                 if (NULL!=q->tail)
00164                                         (q->tail)->next=tmp;
00165 
00166                                 // insert element
00167                                 q->tail = tmp;
00168 
00169                                 //was the queue empty?
00170                                 if (NULL==q->head)
00171                                         q->head=tmp;
00172 
00173                                 // success
00174                                 returnCode = 1;
00175                                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put_nb: QUEUED q[%x] node[%x] queue_node[%x]", q, node, tmp);
00176                         //}
00177 
00178                 } else {
00179                         returnCode = 0; // ERROR
00180                 }
00181 
00182         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00183 
00184         return returnCode;
00185 }//[/queue_put]
00186 
00187 /**
00188  * Retrieves the next node from a queue
00189  *
00190  * @return NULL if none.
00191  *
00192  */
00193 void *queue_get(queue *q) {
00194 
00195         if (NULL==q) {
00196                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_get: NULL queue ptr");
00197                 return NULL;
00198         }
00199 
00200         queue_node *tmp = NULL;
00201         void *node=NULL;
00202 
00203         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00204 
00205                 tmp = q->head;
00206                 if (tmp!=NULL) {
00207 
00208                         // adjust tail: case if tail==head
00209                         //  ie. only one element present
00210                         if (q->head == q->tail) {
00211                                 q->tail = NULL;
00212                         }
00213 
00214                         // adjust head : next pointer is already set
00215                         //  to NULL in queue_put
00216                         q->head = (q->head)->next;
00217 
00218                         node = tmp->node;
00219 
00220                         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_get: MESSAGE PRESENT, freeing queue_node[%x]", tmp);
00221                         free(tmp);
00222                 }
00223 
00224         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00225 
00226         return node;
00227 }//[/queue_get]
00228 
00229 /**
00230  * Retrieves the next node from a queue (non-blocking)
00231  *
00232  * @return NULL => No node OR BUSY
00233  *
00234  */
00235 void *queue_get_nb(queue *q) {
00236 
00237         if (NULL==q) {
00238                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_get_nb: NULL queue ptr");
00239                 return NULL;
00240         }
00241 
00242         queue_node *tmp = NULL;
00243         void *node=NULL;
00244 
00245         if (EBUSY==pthread_mutex_trylock( q->mutex )) {
00246                 return NULL;
00247         }
00248 
00249                 tmp = q->head;
00250                 if (NULL!=tmp) {
00251 
00252                         // adjust tail: case if tail==head
00253                         //  ie. only one element present
00254                         if (q->head == q->tail) {
00255                                 q->tail = NULL;
00256                         }
00257 
00258                         q->head = (q->head)->next;
00259                         node = tmp->node;
00260 
00261                         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_get_nb: NODE PRESENT, q[%x] envlp[%x], freeing queue_node[%x]", q, node, tmp);
00262                         free(tmp);
00263 
00264                 }
00265 
00266         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00267 
00268         return node;
00269 }//[/queue_get]

00271 /**
00272  * Verifies if a message is present
00273  *
00274  * @return 1 if at least 1 message is present,
00275  * @return 0  if NONE
00276  * @return -1 on ERROR
00277  *
00278  */
00279 int queue_peek(queue *q) {
00280 
00281         if (NULL==q) {
00282                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_peek: NULL queue ptr");
00283                 return -1;
00284         }
00285 
00286         queue_node *tmp = NULL;
00287         int result = 0;
00288 
00289         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00290 
00291                 tmp = q->head;
00292                 result = (tmp!=NULL);
00293 
00294         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00295 
00296         return result;
00297 } // queue_peek
